file_content.text: Major, welcome back! General, the major is here.
Not a moment too soon. Come with me, Major. We were supposed to be in the Supreme Chancellor's office ten minutes ago.
I'm sorry, I didn't realize we'd been summoned.
My apologies.
No need to apologize. Just come along.
What's the situation, General?
Is something wrong?
The situation is that the Supreme Chancellor of the Republic is waiting for us. Come along.
I'm really not in the mood to chat with bureaucrats, General.
Not more politics.
Nobody is interested in your mood, Major. When the Supreme Chancellor calls, you answer. Come on.
General Garza, hello! Please, come in, make yourself comfortable.
And Major, so good to see you again. It seems I can't blink without you winning yet another incredible victory for us.
It's good to see you too, Your Excellency.
Thank you.
It's not easy being so incredible, believe me.
I know, I'm amazing.
And you must be the commander of Havoc Squad. I've been hearing a lot about you recently--it's a pleasure to finally meet you.
I'm very pleased to meet you, Your Excellency.
This is an honor.
I never thought I'd actually meet the Supreme Chancellor.
Wow!
I'm no more impressive than any other servant of the Republic. I've certainly never achieved anything comparable to your victory on Corellia.
You want to tell me why I'm here?
Get to the point.
I only wanted to congratulate you on your victory. Defeating General Rakton was no small task.
I didn't become fully aware of Havoc Squad's achievements until I took office. Your service to the Republic has been truly remarkable.
For your exemplary service in the defense of the Republic, you are hereby awarded the Chancellor's Service Medal. Congratulations, Major.
I'm truly honored, Your Excellency.
Thank you very much.
I only wish I could do more to recognize the work you've done.
Will the other members of Havoc Squad be recognized as well?
What about my squad?
Each of your squad-mates will be awarded Silver Crescents to recognize their contributions to your defeat of General Rakton.
Finally, some real recognition.
It's about time.
I hope you haven't felt slighted up until now--the Republic certainly appreciates your work.
With Rakton gone, the Imperial military is weaker than ever. For the first time in many years, we have the advantage.
It's been a long, hard fight, but we've come out on top.
We've come a long way.
For now, yes--but we must be cautious to maintain what we've fought so hard to gain.
Do you think the Empire might give up the fight?
Will they surrender?
At best, we'll drive them back to the fringes of the galaxy and spend decades hunting them across obscure Rim worlds.
But the people of the Republic will be safe from their assaults, and that is what our work is all about.
If I have to hunt down every last Imp myself, I will.
Soon we'll destroy them all.
Even disadvantaged, the Empire is not done yet. Much work remains before the galaxy is safe.
We're all fortunate to have defenders as skilled and clever as yourselves. Meeting with you has been a very great pleasure.
I wish you good fortune in all your future missions, and know that the Republic is proud of everything you've achieved.
Thank you very much for your time, Your Excellency.
General, Major, welcome back! How did your meeting go?
Even better than expected. I'm proud that you stood up to the Chancellor, Major--I had almost resigned myself to the idea of hunting Rakton down all over again.
I'm glad you approve, General.
Thank you.
I'm sure you've saved a great many lives by changing her mind on the matter.
I wasn't sure speaking up would do any good, but I had to try.
I'm just glad she listened.
I'm glad you did. There's no telling how many lives you've saved by changing Saresh's mind.
I can't believe our own Supreme Chancellor would want to do something so stupid.
That woman was a fool.
Very few people are prepared to make the kinds of choices we make on a daily basis. We're just fortunate she listened to reason.
Very well. The Supreme Chancellor was impressed with the major's accomplishments. You really have gone above and beyond the call of duty, Major.
I'm just proud to do my part, General.
Thank you very much.
You do far more than just your part. No matter how much is asked of you, you always deliver.
Do you have another mission lined up for us, General?
What's next?
Not at the moment, but that's likely to change soon.
A trinket and a "thank you"--that's my reward?
Is that all I get?
If one of the highest awards in the Republic and the personal thanks of the Supreme Chancellor aren't enough, then you're out of luck.
As I said, our work doesn't end here. Imperial forces are already regrouping on Ilum and elsewhere.
And though you were honored today, the killing of Senator Zian hasn't been forgotten. It's best if you keep a low profile for the time being.
It won't be long before your team is called back to the front lines. You should take this time to get what rest you can.
So what's the plan? Where do we go from here?
What are your plans, Major? What will we do now?
I'd say we've all earned some away time, wouldn't you?
Vacation for everyone.
Yuun hopes that we can find a temporary peace proportional to the chaotic path we've walked.
The enemy doesn't take time off, so neither do we. Let's get back out there, people.
Let's find another fight.
We will fight until the last Imperial lies dying at our feet!
I'd say it's time to find out who wants to buy the heroes some drinks. Who's in?
I'm hitting the cantina.
You know you can always count on me, boss.
I suppose I could join in, just this once.
Somebody's got to keep you from getting into too much trouble. I'll go.
Just be sure to keep your holo close by, Major. When the next crisis comes, Havoc Squad will get the first call.
The Supreme Chancellor is trading Rakton back to the Empire, alive and well. I can't begin to imagine how difficult it will be to capture him again.
We have a duty to uphold the Supreme Chancellor's decisions, no matter what.
It was her call, not ours.
Upholding her decisions and approving of them are very different things. What a mess.
We captured Rakton once. We can do it again.
Nothing is impossible.
Let's hope so. We have no other choice, now.
How could anyone be stupid enough to set Rakton free?
I can't believe it either.
Obviously, the lure of an easy solution was too much for her. Bureaucrats.
Even without this setback, our war against the Empire is far from over. Their forces are already regrouping on Ilum and elsewhere.
For your meritorious actions and unequaled valor in service of the Republic, you are hereby awarded our highest honor--the Cross of Glory. Congratulations.
I'm honored to accept this award, Your Excellency.
Thank you very much.
You've more than earned it, Major. The people of the Republic owe you a debt that can never fully be repaid.
Will my team be recognized for their work as well?
What about my squad?
The other members of Havoc Squad will each receive Gold Crescents for their contributions to the capture of General Rakton.
Nice to know my work is finally being appreciated.
It's about time.
Well, if you've felt slighted in the past, I certainly apologize. The Republic is very fortunate to have such a skilled defender.
It's hard to believe we actually have the Empire's greatest general in our custody. He's the best bargaining chip we've ever laid hands on.
Excuse me, Your Excellency, but what do you mean exactly?
A trade. In return for Rakton, the Empire is willing to release thousands of Republic prisoners. It's an incredible opportunity.
With respect, wouldn't it be extremely dangerous to release Rakton ?
Are you sure that's wise?
I believe the risk is more than outweighed by the reward. We've beaten him once--we can beat him again.
I'm impressed that the Empire would offer so much.
That is a great opportunity.
Apparently, Rakton is still very important to them, even in his current condition.
With respect, Supreme Chancellor, this seems like an incredibly reckless proposition.
After everything we've been through to capture Rakton, you want to let him go?
You can't send Rakton back!
He doesn't do us any good rotting in a cell, does he?
Think of the countless families reunited--thousands of husbands and wives, parents and children, all brought home at last.
And what of the many thousands more killed by Rakton in his campaigns, Your Excellency? Don't they deserve some kind of justice?
We can't help the dead, General. But we can help the living, and we have a duty to do so.
As Supreme Chancellor, the choice is yours.
This is your decision.
Yes--and the correct choice seems obvious to me.
We have a chance to save thousands of Republic lives. We should take it.
I agree.
I'm glad you agree, Major.
Be proud--your actions have freed thousands of soldiers from enemy custody, and proven that we can defeat the Empire's greatest general.
It's been a pleasure, Major. Good luck in your future missions, and know that the Republic appreciates your many sacrifices.
Good day, Your Excellency.
If you send Rakton back to the Empire, then this medal will be meaningless, along with the deaths of countless good soldiers.
Let Rakton go and I quit!
We might get thousands of our people back, but with Rakton's help, the Empire can kill twice that number in a day.
I won't stand for this, Chancellor. I won't watch you hand the Empire's deadliest weapon back to them.
You... you won't have to, Major. You're absolutely right--Rakton must remain in our custody.
I appreciate hearing your thoughts on the matter--it's been a pleasure meeting with you. Unfortunately, other matters press, please excuse me.
Of course, Your Excellency. Good day.
